verses.verse: And there was a man<WH376> of the hill-country<WH2022> of Ephraim<WH669>, whose name<WH8034> was Micah<WH4321>.

And he said<WH559> unto his mother<WH517>, The eleven hundred<WH505> pieces of silver<WH3701> that were taken<WH3947> from thee<WH422>, about which thou didst utter a curse, and didst also speak<WH559> it in mine ears<WH241>, behold<WH3701>, the silver is with me<WH3947>; I took it<WH517>. And his mother said<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be my son<WH1121> of Jehovah<WH3068>.

And he restored<WH7725> the eleven hundred<WH505> pieces of silver<WH3701> to his mother<WH517>; and his mother<WH517> said<WH559>, I verily<WH6942> dedicate<WH6942> the silver<WH3701> unto Jehovah<WH3068> from my hand<WH3027> for my son<WH1121>, to make<WH6213> a graven image<WH6459> and a molten image<WH6459>: now therefore I will restore it unto thee<WH7725>.

And when he restored<WH7725> the money<WH3701> unto his mother<WH517>, his mother<WH517> took<WH3947> two hundred<WH3967> pieces of silver<WH3701>, and gave<WH5414> them to the founder<WH6884>, who made<WH6213> thereof a graven image<WH6459> and a molten image<WH4541>: and it was in the house<WH1004> of Micah<WH4321>.

And the man<WH376> Micah<WH4318> had a house<WH1004> of gods<WH430>, and he made<WH6213> an ephod<WH646>, and teraphim<WH8655>, and consecrated<WH4390> one<WH259> of his sons<WH1121>, who became his priest<WH3548>.
In those days<WH3117> there was no king<WH4428> in Israel<WH3478>: every man<WH376> did<WH6213> that which was right<WH3477> in his own eyes<WH5869>.
And there was a young man<WH5288> out of Beth-lehem<WH1035>-judah, of the family<WH4940> of Judah<WH3063>, who was a Levite<WH3881>; and he sojourned there<WH1481>.

And the man<WH376> departed<WH3212> out of the city<WH5892>, out of Beth-lehem<WH1035>-judah, to sojourn<WH1481> where he could find<WH4672> a place<WH935>, and he came to the hill-country<WH2022> of Ephraim<WH669> to the house<WH1004> of Micah<WH4318>, as he journeyed<WH6213>.

And Micah<WH4318> said<WH559> unto him<WH370>, Whence comest<WH935> thou<WH559>? And he said unto him<WH3881>, I am a Levite of Beth-lehem<WH1035>-judah, and I go<WH1980> to sojourn<WH1481> where I may find a place<WH4672>.

And Micah<WH4318> said<WH559> unto him<WH3427>, Dwell with me<WH1>, and be unto me a father and a priest<WH3548>, and I will give<WH5414> thee ten<WH6235> pieces of silver<WH3701> by the year<WH3117>, and a suit<WH6187> of apparel<WH899>, and thy victuals<WH4241>. So the Levite<WH3881> went in<WH3212>.
And the Levite<WH3881> was content<WH2974> to dwell<WH3427> with the man<WH376>; and the young man<WH5288> was unto him as one<WH259> of his sons<WH1121>.
And Micah<WH4318> consecrated<WH4390> the Levite<WH3881>, and the young man<WH5288> became his priest<WH3548>, and was in the house<WH1004> of Micah<WH4318>.
Then said<WH559> Micah<WH4318>, Now know<WH3045> I that Jehovah<WH3068> will do me good<WH3190>, seeing I have a Levite<WH3881> to my priest<WH3548>.
